options.B: P tries to access a page that is in the swap space, triggering a page fault
options.C: An interrupt is raised by the disk to deliver data requested by some other process
options.D: A timer interrupt is raised by the hardware

question:
Question 30 Consider the following context-free grammar where the start symbol is [latex] S [/latex] and the set of terminals is [latex] \{a, b, c, d\} [/latex]. [latex]
\begin{aligned}
& S \rightarrow A a A b \mid B b B a \\
& A \rightarrow c S \mid \epsilon \\
& B \rightarrow d S \mid \epsilon
\end{aligned}
 [/latex] The following is a partially-filled LL(1) parsing table. [latex]
\begin{array}{|c|c|c|c|c|c|}
 \hline  &   a   &   b   &   c   &   d   &   \$   \\
\hline  S   &   S \rightarrow A a A b   &   S \rightarrow B b B a   &   (1)   &   (2)   & \\
\hline  A   &   A \rightarrow \epsilon   &   (3)   &   A \rightarrow c S   & & \\
\hline  B   &   (4)   &   B \rightarrow \epsilon   & &   B \rightarrow d S   & \\
\hline
\end{array}[/latex] Which one of the following options represents the CORRECT combination for the numbered cells in the parsing table? Note: In the options, "blank" denotes that the corresponding cell is empty.
solution: Click here for detail solution by gateoverflow

options.A: (1) [latex] S \rightarrow A a A b [/latex] (2) [latex] S \rightarrow B b B a [/latex] (3) [latex] A \rightarrow \epsilon [/latex] (4) [latex] B \rightarrow \epsilon [/latex]
options.B: (1) [latex] S \rightarrow B b B a [/latex] (2) [latex] S \rightarrow A a A b [/latex] (3) [latex] A \rightarrow \epsilon [/latex] (4) [latex] B \rightarrow \epsilon [/latex]
options.C: (1) [latex] S \rightarrow A a A b [/latex] (2) [latex] S \rightarrow B b B a [/latex] (3) blank (4) blank
options.D: (1) [latex] S \rightarrow B b B a [/latex] (2) [latex] S \rightarrow A a A b [/latex] (3) blank (4) blank
